title.narrative: DRR AND EMERGENCY IN HEALTH SYSTEM

description.narrative: Health system is strengthened for DRR and emergency response, which contributes to Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Health And Emergencies, Nutrition And Emergencies, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased percentage of young children, particularly Roma and CWD, benefitting from equitable, gender- sensitive, quality health and other Early Child Development (ECD) services and supportive parental practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Health system is strengthened for DRR and emergency response

description.narrative: The health system continued to provide quality support for infant and young child feeding (IYCF) to refugee and migrant mothers/families and children, while UNICEF support expanded to system-strengthening for routine immunization of children and prevention of substance abuse among adolescents on the move as a new area of intervention. The emergency response to the COVID-19 pandemic strengthened the health system with necessary medical equipment, up-to-date professional knowledge and new teleworking modalities, and effective communication and outreach to the most vulnerable communities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/12/2020
